poem:
**Striking the Sky**

Skyward dealings, a dance of giants,  
Warner's worlds in ink and pact,  
Barbie and HBO, futures intact,  
A script to tether dreams in alliance.  

Streaming tides, advert tales,  
Max and Discovery waltz as one,  
Stories sealed, in spectral run,  
Sky's bright hold, no shadow fails.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sky strikes Warner Bros Discovery deal, averting exodus of shows Sky has struck a crucial content deal with Warner Bros Discovery, the owner of the film studio behind Barbie and HBO shows including Succession, averting a potential crippling exodus of shows as the Hollywood giant prepares the launch of its Max streaming service. Under the deal between Sky’s parent company Comcast and WBD, the ad-supported versions of WBD’s Max and Discovery+ services will be bundled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Sky strikes Warner Bros Discovery deal, averting exodus of shows Sky has struck a crucial content deal with Warner Bros Discovery, the owner of the film studio behind Barbie and HBO shows including Succession, averting a potential crippling exodus of shows as the Hollywood giant prepares the launch of its Max streaming service. Under the deal between Sky’s parent company Comcast and WBD, the ad-supported versions of WBD’s Max and Discovery+ services will be bundled
